activities.loc: Branch 2 Courtroom, 2nd Floor, Oneida County Courthouse

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Shane Steven Brunette

records.descr: Answer to demand for discovery and inspection
Answer to demand for discovery and inspection

records.addlTxt:
2:02 PM Defendant Shane Steven Brunette in court.  Attorney Elizabeth F Svehlek in court for Shane Steven Brunette.  Prosecuting attorney Michael William Schiek in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Svehlek statement to status- defendant trying to get into inpatient treatment. Received offer from state but request adj for defendant to enter treatment. Schiek statement. 
Bail continued
Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 8, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

9:46 AM Prosecuting attorney Jillian Pfeifer in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Shane Steven Brunette appears via telephonically.  Attorney Elizabeth F Svehlek in court for Shane Steven Brunette. Court goes over record and questions defendant as to why he called Judicial assistant questioning when he has court.  Defendant statement. Court informs defendant that he must appear in his court room or a warrant will be issued.   Atty Svehlek statement spoke with defendant and is willing to waive.  Defendant waives preliminary hearing. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that probable cause exists and binds over.  Atty Pfeiferstates Information will be filed that mirrors Complaint. Atty Svehlek  willing to proceed to Arraignment today; waives further reading and enters not guilty pleas. Bond continued. adj. 9;51 a.m.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 30, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on July 12, 2022 at 09:30 am.

1:26 PM Prosecuting attorney Mary M Sowinski Ms. in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Shane Steven Brunette in court.  Attorney Elizabeth F Svehlek in court for Shane Steven Brunette. 
Defendant makes Voluntary Appearance - Svehlek statement to non appearance - Court quashes warrant. 
In receipt, waive reading -to be set for preliminary hearing. Beth to go with client to obtain date from br II after hearing. 
Sowinski to bail - Court reinstates $500 cash bond.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: 2:57 PM Prosecuting attorney Jillian Pfeifer in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Shane Steven Brunette not in court. Calling 22CF130 & 22TR1209. Court states bond was posted . Pfeifer requests warrant be authorized. Court authorizes warrant and defaults 22TR1209. adj. 02:58 PM

1:17 PM Prosecuting attorney Michael William Schiek in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Shane Steven Brunette appeared by video, in custody. Calling 22CF130 & 22TR1209. Defendant does not have copy of complaint - court reads charges, right to counsel. Schiek/Defendant statement to bail. Court sets bond. Defendant to appear at next hearing in person if bond is posted. adj. 01:23 PM
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 13, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
